Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-  Rive:Initial Appearance as to Francisco Colon-Miranda (6), Christhian Agron-Martinez (14), Johny D. Ortiz-Cancel (22), Jesus Nevarez-Ortiz (31), Axel Rosario-Lopez (32), Jose Febus-Rios (35), LNU FNU (36), Omar Salaberrios (37), Juan Luis Calderon- Torres (38), Juan Lopez-Cruz (39), Carlos J. Perez-Fuentes (40), Gloria Ramirez (41) held on 4/29/2014. Defendants were provided with copy of the indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. Defendant # 36 clarified that his true and correct name is HYATT HERNANDEZ-HERNANDEZ. The Court ordered that the correct name be changed in the docket. After reviewing the financial affidavits filed by the defendants, the Court ordered that attorneys from the CJA Panel be appointed to represent each one of them. Arraignment/Detention set for 5/2/2014 at 10:00 AM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. Defendants are ordered detained pending hearings. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Christhian Figueroa-Rosario (30) Count 1,2,3,4 held on 5/7/2014. Present were SAUSA Maria Montanez and Ms Diana Lopez-Feliciano. Dft was present and under custody. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for scheduling. As to bail, the Government requested detention without bail. As defense counsel argued against it, the Government called to the witness stand HIS SA Luis Fombellida. Direct and cross-examination conducted. Exhibits 1 and 2 presented and admitted into evidence, and then returned to the Government. Sidebar held. Ater hearing the testimony of the witness and the arguments from the parties, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Ms Lopez-Feliciano reserved the right to request the reopening of the hearing. Order to issue. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Change of Plea Hearing as to Jean Sanchez-Encarnacion (20) held on 1/14/2015. Present were SAUSA Maria Montanez and Mr. Juan Milanes. Dft was present and under custody. Waiver of JT and consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to understand the proceedings. He is advised of the maximum penalties he's facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving said rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Judge Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to counts One (1) and Five (5)of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Judge Cerezo. Defendant to remain under custody. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Johny D. Ortiz-Cancel (22) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 3/5/2015. Present were SAUSA Maria Montanez and Mr. Ramon Garay. Dft was present and under custody. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for scheduling. The Government requested detention and argued in favor of the same. Mr. Garay agreed with PT report and argued for bail. After hearing the arguments from the parties, the Court informed defendant that he would be given an opportunity if he was willing to attend a residential treatment program. The defendant accepted. Bail was set in the amount of $2,500.00 unsecured with defendant's and his mother's signature, residential program, mental health, and all other standard conditions. He was also advised that if he didn't comply with all the rules of the program, a new hearing will be held to revoke his bail. (Court Reporter -DCR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:58.Hearing ended at 02:08.Interpreter -Enith Valdes. (yr) (Entered: 03/10/2015)

Montanez and defense counsel Wilfredo Rios were present. Defense counsel informed that, after a lengthy plea negotiation and after defendant's wife contacted counsel informing that defendant was going to plea, today defendant preferred to go to trial. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Change of Plea Hearing as to Carlos J. Perez-Fuentes (40) held on 4/13/2015. Present were SAUSA Maria Montanez and Mr. Jedrick Burgos. Dft was present and on bond. Waiver of JT and consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to understand the proceedings. He is advised of the maximum penalties he's facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving said rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Judge Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to count One (1) of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Judge Cerezo. Mr. Burgos addressed the Court stating that it was defendant's wish to self-surrender tomorrow, April 14, to the US Marshals in order to begin serving his term. (E-mail to USPO) (Court Reporter -DCR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:34.Hearing ended at 11:02.Interpreter -Enith Valdes. (yr) (Entered: 04/13/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo:Sentencing held on 11/20/2015 for Yimen Clemente-Torres (15). PRESENT: AUSA Maria Montanez, Attorney Julie Soderlund and USPO Casanova. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Bruce J. McGiverin: Change of Plea Hearing as to German Vazquez-Ortiz (10) held on 1/31/2017. Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata and Atty. Jose Novas. Defendant is under custody, present in court, and assisted by the court interpreter. Consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to plea. The defendant is advised of the maximum penalties he is facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving his constitutional rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to U.S. District Judge Carmen C. Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to count 1 of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre- Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing set for 5/2/2017 04:15 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 09:00. Hearing held at 10:29. Hearing ended at 10:51. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (ari) (Entered: 01/31/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Bond Revocation Hearing as to Johny D. Ortiz-Cancel (22) held on 2/3/2017. Present were AUSA Max Perez and Mr. Ramon Garay, as well as USPO Mariela Fernandez and USPO Wendy Moreno. Defendant was present and under custody. Mr.  Garay argued against revocation of bail as defendant has been complying with the conditions imposed. AUSA Perez argued for revocation and produced some documents, which the Court ordered that the same be shown to defense counsel, and gave a short break so that the same could be discussed with defendant. After the break, Mr. Garay informed that defendant would not be disputing the content of the documents, and requested a modification of the bail conditions. The Government opposed said request. After hearing both parties, the Court ruled that defendant's bail was revoked and ordered him detained without bail. (Court Reporter -DCR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:04.Hearing ended at 10:50.Interpreter -Mary Jo Smith. (yr) (Entered: 02/16/2017)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Motion Hearing as to Carlos Medina-Morales (1) held on 8/23/2017 re 1276 Motion for Hearing regarding Legal Representation. Present: AUSA Maria Montanez and Atty. Rachel Brill. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Defense counsel informed that this is a one sided manner and requested the hearing be held as an ex-parte hearing and AUSA Montanez be excused. The government had no objection. The Court excused AUSA Montanez. Defense counsel informed that the issues stated in the motion were resolved, she had spoken to the defendant, answered all of his doubts and both agreed that she would continue representing him. After the Court speaking directly to the defendant, asking if he agreed with what Atty. Brill had stated and the defendant answering in the affirmative, the Court informed that Counsel Rachel Brill would remain representing him. (Court Reporter DCR.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 03:11. Hearing ended at 03:25. Interpreter Mary Jo Smith. (nat) Modified to correct typographical error on 8/25/2017 (idg). (Entered: 08/24/2017)

Alvarez stated that his client filed a 1134 Motion to Appoint New Counsel, but has informed him that he doesn't want a new attorney and requests that the motion be withdrawn. Request granted. Atty. Alvarez will remain as defendant's attorney. As to the status of the case, plea offer was rejected by defendant. Counter-offer sent to government. Parties are engaged in plea negotiations. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Change of Plea Hearing as to Carlos Medina-Morales (1) held on 3/5/2018. Present were AUSA Maria Montanez and Ms Rachel Brill. Defendant was present and under custody. Waiver of JT and consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. Defendant was advised of the maximum penalties he's facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving said rights, and the statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Judge Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to counts One (1) and Five (5)of the indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Defendant will remain under custody. Sentencing Hearing set for 6/5/2018 at 01:15 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo: Sentencing held on

20/2018 for Julio Perez-Rosario (28). Present: AUSA Maria Montanez, Atty. Miguel Oppenheimer and USPO Milva Razetto. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The Court addressed Order entered at docket no. 1422 , no matters pending. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. No allocution was heard by the defendant. Government's statement was heard. Count(s) 1, 5, IMPR: Twenty-seven (27) months as to Count One and sixty (60) months as to Count Five, to be served consecutively to each other for a total of eighty-seven (87) months. SRT: Six (6) years as to Count One and Three (3) years as to Count Five, to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $100.00 per count. Count(s) 2, 3, 4, Dismissed as requested by the government. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa.) Hearing set for 01:00. Hearing held at 01:13. Hearing ended at 01:27. Interpreter Olga Uribe. (nat) (Entered: 03/20/2018)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo: Sentencing held on 7/10/2018 for Jose Rivera-Couvertier (12). Present: AUSA Maria Montanez, Atty. Juan Alvarez and USPO Andres Narvaez. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defense counsel's request for the sentence imposed in this case to be served concurrent to the one imposed in the state level court is DENIED. No allocution was heard by the defendant. Government's statement was heard. Count(s) 1, 5, IMPR: Eighty-four (84) months as to Count One and sixty (60) months as to Count Five, to be served consecutively to each other for a total of one hundred and forty-four (144) months. SRT: Eight (8) years as to Count One and five (5) years as to Count Five to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $100.00 per count. Forfeiture. Count(s) 2, 3, 4, Dismissed as requested by the government. (Court Reporter Zulma Ruiz.) Hearing set for 01:15. Hearing held at 01:25. Hearing ended at 01:45. Interpreter Edna Brayfield. (nat) (Entered: 07/10/2018)

JUDGMENT as to Jose Rivera-Couvertier (12), Count(s) 1, 5, IMPR: Eighty-four (84) months as to Count One and sixty (60) months as to Count Five, to be served consecutively to each other for a total of one hundred and forty-four (144) months. SRT: Eight (8) years as to Count One and five (5) years as to Count Five to be served concurrently with each other. No fine. SMA of $100.00 per count. Forfeiture. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo: Sentencing held on 9/17/2018 for Carlos Medina-Morales (1). Present: AUSA Teresa Zapata, Atty. Rachel Brill and USPO Carmen Villeta. Defendant was U/C, present in court and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. The Court questioned the defendant as to specific details said during his allocution. Defense counsel Brill was given a moment to confer with defendant about these questions and his allocution. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jesus Nevarez- Ortiz (31) held on 10/10/2019. Present: AFPD Cherrelle Herbert on behalf of the defendant. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Copy of ECF No. 1614 was provided to the defendant. The defendant was advised of the alleged SRT violations and also of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filed by the defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The Federal Public Defender was appointed to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Preliminary Revocation Hearing set for 10/25/2019 09:30 AM in Courtroom 6 before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan. The Government is reminded that an interpreter must be provided if any of its witnesses cannot testify in the English Language.(Court Reporter DCR-Courtroom 6.)Hearing held at 03:42.Hearing ended at 03:50.Interpreter Carlos Ravelo. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Preliminary Revocation Hearing re 1614 Second Motion Notifying SRT Violations and 1623 Supplemental Motion as to Jesus Nevarez-Ortiz (31) held on 11/25/2019. Present: AUSA Maria Montanez, APFD Samantha Drake and USPO Gabriel Soto. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Testimonies of USPO Soto and PSO Eddie Montalvo were heard on behalf of the Government. The defense accepted the allegations of Grade C violations. However, AFPD Drake challenged the Grade B violation in the form of new criminal  conduct as alleged by the USPO at Docket No. 1614 . She argued for such conduct to be considered a Grade C violation instead. The Government argued for probable cause as to all allegations included in both motions. After having heard the parties and the testimonies of the witnesses, the Court found probable cause as to all allegations contained in Docket Nos. 1614 and 1623 . The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Carmen C. Cerezo for Final Revocation Hearing. AFPD Drake requested an order for the medical staff at MDC-Guaynabo to perform a mental health evaluation and provide medication as necessary to the defendant. The Court granted the defense's request. BOP is ordered to evaluate the defendant forthwith for the potential continuation of medication that he had been receiving for specific mental health conditions while he was previously under custody. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set for 1/9/2020 02:00 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. (Court Reporter DCR-Courtroom 6.)Hearing set for 09:30.Hearing held at 10:45.Hearing ended at 11:41.Interpreter Annie Flores. (lod) (Entered: 11/26/2019)

ORDER granting 1659 Motion Requesting Order as to Jesus Nevarez-Ortiz (31). Upon review of defendant Jesus Nevarez Ortiz' Joint Motion for Revocation of Supervised Release filed by both counsel for defendant and for the Government given the current Covid-19 emergency and defendant having waived his right to a  hearing( as per representations made by his counsel) and there being no objection by probation, in accordance with the case law from the First Circuit referenced in the motion, this Court hereby grants the request for revocation of supervised release, revokes the same, and sentences defendant Jesus Nevarez-Ortiz to the time already served and imposes a supervised release term of two (2) years under the same terms and conditions imposed at his sentencing hearing and prevalent at the time of his arrest for his violation of supervised release. Judgment to be issued and entered forthwith.Signed by Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory on 4/6/2020. (su) (Entered: 04/06/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan: Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Jesus Nevarez- Ortiz (31) held on 10/29/2020. Present: AUSA Evelyn Canals and AFPD Ivan Santos. The defendant was present, under custody at MDC and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived her right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. The defendant was advised of the SRT violations alleged in the Supplemental Motion filed by USPO Reyes at Docket No. 1716 . The defendant was also advised of her rights, including her right to a preliminary hearing. The Federal Public Defender shall continue representing the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. Pursuant to the  Due Process Protections Act, the Court confirmed the United States obligation to produce all exculpatory evidence to the defendant pursuant to Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny, and ordered it to do so. Failing to do so in a timely manner may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, exclusion of evidence, adverse jury instructions, dismissal of charges, contempt proceedings or sanctions by the Court. Preliminary Revocation Hearing set for 11/9/2020 02:45 PM in VTC Bridge MDM before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan. (Court Reporter Rachelle Robinson.)Hearing set for 02:00.Hearing held at 02:17.Hearing ended at  02:28. Interpreter Ani Navarro. (lod) (Entered: 11/03/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Jesus Nevarez-Ortiz (31) held on 11/9/2020. Present: AUSA Marie Christine Amy (for Evelyn Canals), AFPD Edwin Mora (for Sulay Rios) and USPO Desiree Reyes. The defendant was present, under custody at MDC and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. The Court found that the defendant knowingly and voluntarily waived her right to attend this hearing in person and consented to proceed by way of VTC. AFPD Mora stated that the defendant, after having conferred with AFPD Rios, intended to waive her right to a preliminary hearing. The Court accepted the defendant's oral waiver, subject to the subsequent filing of the duly executed waiver form. The Court then entered a finding of probable cause as to all violations included in the Supplemental Motion filed by USPO at Docket No. 1716 , pursuant to Rules 5 and 32.1 of the Fed.R.Crim.P. The case was referred to U.S. Senior District Judge Jay A. Garcia-Gregory for Final Revocation Hearing. The defendant shall remain detained pending further proceedings.Signed Waiver of Preliminary Hearing form to be filed by the defense within 14 days. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release to be set by the Presiding Judge. Present: AUSA Evelyn Canals and AFPD Andrew McCutcheon. Defendant present, under SRT conditions and assisted by the Court Interpreter. USPO Mariela Fernandez also present. The findings under the CARES Act should reflect that given the exigent circumstances created by the COVID pandemic and the Declaration of Emergency by the State and Federal Government, this hearing is being conducted by VTC in order to ensure the rights of the defendant, his eligibility for programs subsequent to sentencing, which will turn to his benefit, and the health of all the parties involved. Defense did not contest the violations, as so informed by the Supervising US Probation Officer. However, made certain clarifications on the record. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Requested an imprisonment term not be imposed and defendant be revoked to continue under SRT conditions. Defendant's allocution heard. Government had no objection to the request. Court will not make a finding as to the violation of Standard Condition #9. Considering the positive adjustments defendant has made and remains employed, the Court imposed a variance sentence. SRT revoked and defendant is to serve 3 months under home detention and an electronic monitoring device shall be in place. SRT of 7 years is imposed. (Court Reporter Amy Walker.) Hearing set for 11:00 a.m. Hearing held at 11:15 a.m. Hearing ended at 11:40 a.m. Interpreter Janis Palma. (sr) (Entered: 05/06/2021)

JUDGMENT ON REVOCATION as to Jose Febus-Rios (35). Revoked to SRT of 7 years, including 3 months of home detention with electronic monitoring. Signed by Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon on 5/6/2021.(sr) (Entered: 05/06/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Initial appearance on revocation of supervised release as to Hyatt Hernandez-Hernandez (36) held on 5/20/2021. AUSA Marie C. Amy and AFPD Jessica Earl were present. Defendant was under custody, present and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily consented to the holding of the hearing via VTC. Defendant was advised of the alleged SRT violations filed at ECF No. 1787 and his right to a preliminary hearing to determine whether his supervised release conditions have been violated. The Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. The FPD was appointed to represent the defendant. Defendant was ordered detained pending the preliminary revocation hearing. A preliminary revocation hearing was set for 6/4/2021 at 01:30 pm via VTC before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez. If the government intends to call a witness that is not fluent in the English language, failure of the government to timely retain the services of an interpreter may result in the imposition of sanctions. Pursuant to the Due Process Protections Act, Pub. L. No. 116-182, 134 Stat. 894 (Oct. 21, 2020) and Rule 5(f) of the Federal Rules of Criminal Procedure, the United States is reminded of its obligation to disclose in a timely manner all exculpatory evidence to the defendant(s], that is, all evidence that is favorable to the defendant[s] or tends to cast doubt on the United States case, as required by Brady v. Maryland, 373 U.S. 83 (1963) and its progeny. Failure to comply with this order may result in consequences, including, but not limited to, the exclusion of evidence, dismissal of the revocation proceedings regarding the alleged supervised release violations, contempt proceedings, disciplinary action, and/or sanctions by the Court. (Court Reporter Zoom.) Hearing set for 02:00. Hearing held at 02:25. Hearing ended at 02:32. Interpreter Carlos Ravelo. (jjr) (Entered: 05/20/2021)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Hyatt Hernandez-Hernandez (36) held on 6/4/2021. AUSA Marie C. Amy, AFPD Yasmin Irizarry and USPO Gabriel Soto were present. Defendant was under custody, present, and assisted by a certified court interpreter. All parties were present via VTC. Defendant voluntarily waived his right to be physically present at the courthouse and consented to proceed via VTC. Furthermore, defendant verbally waived his right to the preliminary revocation hearing. The Court accepted the waiver and found probable cause pursuant to the violations contained in the motion filed at ECF No. 1787 . The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Gustavo A. Gelpi for the scheduling of a final revocation hearing. The Court noted that there was consensus as to defendant's request for conditions of release. Therefore, defendant's conditions of supervised release were modified to add the following: Mr. Hernandez will be referred to an in-patient mental health program/hospitalization identified by his USPO. He will remain there as long as the service provider recommends and is covered by his insurance. Upon release, he will be enrolled in an in-patient controlled substance treatment program coordinated by USPO no less than 90 days and/or until the Court schedules the final revocation hearing. (Court Reporter Zoom.) Hearing set for 11:45. Hearing held at 11:17. Hearing ended at 11:28. Interpreter Felix Toledo. (jr) Modified on 6/7/2021 to correct typo (mem). (Entered: 06/07/2021)
